burn.name: Burn
burn.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/16 of their max HP at the end of each turn and have their physical damage dealt halved.
caveats: Pokemon with ability Guts or using the move Facade are not affected by the physical damage halving.
Pokemon with the ability Heatproof lose 1/32 of their max HP instead.
Fire type Pokemon cannot normally be burned.
Pokemon with the ability Water Veil or Water Bubble cannot normally be burned.
Pokemon with the ability Magic Guard do not lose HP from burn, but are still affected by the physical damage halving.
Pokemon with the ability Flare Boost have their Special Attack stat increased by 50% while burned.

freeze.name: Freeze
freeze.description: Affected Pokémon cannot use moves unless they thaw out, which has a 20% chance of happening each turn before attempting to attack.
caveats: Pokemon can not be frozen in Harsh Sun weather.
Ice type Pokemon cannot normally be frozen.
Pokemon with the ability Magma Armor cannot normally be frozen.
Using the moves Fusion Flare, Flame Wheel, Sacred Fire, Flare Blitz, Scald or Steam Eruption by a frozen Pokemon will thaw it out and execute the move.
Frozen Pokemon will thaw out if hit by a damaging Fire type move, Scald, or Steam Eruption.

paralysis.name: Paralysis
paralysis.description: Affected Pokémon have their effective Speed stat halved and have a 25% chance of being unable to move each turn ('fully paralyzed').
caveats: Electric type Pokemon cannot normally be paralyzed.
Pokemon with the ability Limber cannot normally be paralyzed.
Pokemon with the ability Quick Feet have their effective Speed stat instead increased by 50% while paralyzed.
Pokemon with the ability Magic Guard are not affected by the fully paralyzed chance, but still have their Speed halved.

poison.name: Poison
poison.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn.
caveats: Poison type Pokemon cannot normally be poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Poison Heal instead regain 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn while poisoned.
Steel type Pokemon cannot normally be poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Immunity cannot normally be poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Magic Guard do not lose HP from poison.
Poison and Steel type Pokemon can be poisoned only by a Pokemon with the ability Corrosion.

toxic.name: Toxic Poison
toxic.description: Affected Pokémon lose an increasing fraction of their max HP at the end of each turn, starting at 1/16 and increasing by 1/16 each turn they remain poisoned.
caveats: Poison type Pokemon cannot normally be toxic poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Poison Heal instead regain 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn while toxic poisoned.
Steel type Pokemon cannot normally be toxic poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Immunity cannot normally be toxic poisoned.
Pokemon with the ability Magic Guard do not lose HP from toxic poison.
Poison and Steel type Pokemon can be toxic poisoned only by a Pokemon with the ability Corrosion.
The badly poisoned counter resets to 0 if the affected Pokemon is switched out.

sleep.name: Sleep
sleep.description: Affected Pokémon cannot use moves until they wake up, which has a 50% chance of happening each turn before attempting to attack, for up to 3 turns.
caveats: If sleep is induced by the move Rest, the condition lasts for 2 turns.
Pokemon with the ability Insomnia or Vital Spirit cannot normally be put to sleep.

confusion.name: Confusion
confusion.description: Affected Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves in confusion instead of executing their intended move each turn, for 2 to 5 turns.
caveats: If a confused Pokemon hurts itself, it deals damage equal to move with 40 base power as a typeless physical attack, which cannot miss, not affected by STAB, and cannot deal critical hits.

infatuation.name: Infatuation
infatuation.description: Affected Pokémon have a 50% chance of being unable to move each turn due to infatuation.
caveats: Infatuation only occurs when a Pokemon is attracted to an opponent of the opposite gender.

ability_suppression.name: Ability Suppression
ability_suppression.description: Affected Pokémon have their abilities suppressed, preventing any effects from them.
caveats: This condition is typically caused by the move Gastro Acid, Core Enforcer, or the ability Neutralizing Gas
Suppressing abilities fails if the target's ability is Multitype, Stance Change, Schooling, Comatose, Shields Down, Disguise, RKS System, Battle Bond, Power Construct, Ice Face or Gulp Missile.

substitute.name: Substitute
substitute.description: Affected Pokémon create a substitute that takes damage in their place until it is destroyed. The substitute has HP equal to 1/4 of the user's max HP (rounded down).
caveats: A substitute is destroyed when it takes damage equal to or greater than its remaining HP.
Certain moves bypass the substitute, as defined by the move's effects.
Non damaging moves will fail when used against the substitute. Moves which have secondary effects that deal damage will still damage the substitute but will not apply the secondary effect.
Substitutes do not block user-applied status conditions, volatile conditions, or stat changes.
Pokemon with abilities that activate when targeted will still have those abilities activate when targeting a substitute.
Weather damage or other field effects damage the pokemon directly and do not affect the substitute.

bound.name: Bound
bound.description: Affected Pokémon are bound by a move, taking damage equal to 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn for 4 to 5 turns.
caveats: While bound, the affected Pokémon cannot switch out manually, only by forced switching effects.
If the binding move was used by a Pokemon holding a Grip Claw, the duration is extended to 7 turns and the damage is increased to 1/6 of the target's max HP.
A Pokemon can switch out if it is holding the Shed Shell item.
Ghost type Pokemon can switch out as normal while bound.

curse.name: Curse
curse.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/4 of their max HP at the end of each turn for 3 turns.

nightmare.name: Nightmare
nightmare.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/4 of their max HP at the end of each turn while asleep.
caveats: Only affects sleeping Pokémon, if a Pokemon wakes up, the condition ends.

perish_song.name: Perish Song
perish_song.description: Affected Pokémon will faint after 3 turns, the perish count decreases by 1 at the end of each turn.

seeded.name: Leech Seed
seeded.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn, which is restored to the Pokemon in the same position as the Pokemon that used Leech Seed.
caveats: Grass type Pokemon cannot normally be seeded.
Seeded Pokemon with the ability Liquid Ooze will cause the user to lose HP instead of regaining HP.
The amount of HP healed is unaffected by the target's current HP; the user will regain the full 1/8 of the target's max HP even if the target has less than that amount of HP remaining.
HP draining does not occur if the user has fainted or switched out.
Pokemon with the ability Magic Guard do not lose HP from Leech Seed.
If the user has a Big Root held item, the amount of HP restored (or damage inflicted from Liquid Ooze) is increased by 30%; this does not change the damage taken by the seeded Pokemon.
If the move Rapid Spin or Mortal Spin is used by the seeded Pokemon, the Leech Seed condition is removed.

salt_cure.name: Salt Cure
salt_cure.description: Affected Pokémon lose 1/8 of their max HP at the end of each turn.
caveats: Water or Steel type Pokemon lose 1/4 of their max HP instead.

foresight.name: Foresight/Odor Sleuth
foresight.description: Affected Pokémon have their evation stat increases ignored when targeted by any move. Ghost type targets lose their immunity to Normal and Fighting type moves.

miracle_eye.name: Miracle Eye
miracle_eye.description: Affected Pokémon have their evation stat increases ignored when targeted by any move. Dark type targets lose their immunity to Psychic type moves.

minimize.name: Minimize
minimize.description: Damage from the moves Stomp, Steamroller, Body Slam, Dragon Rush, Flying Press and Phantom Force against the affected Pokémon is doubled.

tar_shot.name: Tar Shot
tar_shot.description: Affected Pokémon take double damage from Fire type moves.
caveats: Pokemon that are already Terastalized when affected will not take double damage from Fire type moves.

grounded.name: Grounded
grounded.description: Affected Pokémon can be hit by Ground type moves and are affected by the effects of terrain.

telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
telekinesis.description: Affected Pokémon are levitated and immune to Ground type moves, the effects of terrain, and any effects requiring grounded status.

aqua_ring.name: Aqua Ring
aqua_ring.description: Affected Pokémon regain 1/16 of their max HP at the end of each turn.

rooted.name: Rooted
rooted.description: Affected Pokémon regain 1/16 of their max HP at the end of each turn, but cannot switch out.
caveats: Affected pokemon cannot be forced to switch out with items or the effects of moves.
If the rooted pokemon is holding a Big Root item, the amount of HP restored is increased by 30%.

protect.name: Protect
protect.description: Affected Pokémon are completely protected from most effects of moves for the turn.
caveats: If Protect is used consecutively, its chance of success decreases each time (100% first turn, 50% second turn, 25% third turn, then back to 100% after any failed attempt).

helping_hand.name: Helping Hand
helping_hand.description: Affected Pokémon have their damage dealt increased by 50% for the turn.

power_trick.name: Power Trick
power_trick.description: Affected Pokémon swap their Attack and Defense stats.
caveats: Stat changes to Attack and Defense are retained after the swap.

imprison.name: Imprison
imprison.description: Affected Pokémon cannot use any moves that are known by the user of Imprison.
